page.title: 07Miners Strike.
page.content: A recent event which involved this area was the miner's strike(April '84 to May '85).Ian Mcgregor visited Ellington colliery and was knocked over by protesting miners.Many people argued that he was pushed,most thought that he tripped over a nearby fence. Arthur Scargill (the head supporter of the strike) held a rally in this area which was a great success. There is a NCB workshop and two mines in this area(Ellington and Lynemouth) that were affected. The Deputies of these mines crossed the picket lines with great difficulty ,to make sure that there were no accidents in the empty mine shafts.Many people in the surrounding area thought that if the deputies joined the miners strike it would have been settled at an earlier date.
